t: Luke 22
Now*p the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.
And*p the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.
Then*p entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.
And*p he went his way, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray him unto them.
And*p they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.
And*p he promised, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude.
Then*p came the day of unleavened bread, when the passover must be killed.
And*p he sent Peter and John, saying, Go*r and*r prepare*r us*r the*r passover,*r that*r we*r may*r eat.*r
And*p they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare?

And*p he said unto them, Behold,*r when*r ye*r are*r entered*r into*r the*r city,*r there*r shall*r a*r man*r meet*r you,*r bearing*r a*r pitcher*r of*r water;*r follow*r him*r into*r the*r house*r where*r he*r entereth*r in.*r

And*rp ye*r shall*r say*r unto*r the*r goodman*r of*r the*r house,*r The*r Master*r saith*r unto*r thee,*r Where*r is*r the*r guestchamber,*r where*r I*r shall*r eat*r the*r passover*r with*r my*r disciples?*r
And*rp he*r shall*r shew*r you*r a*r large*r upper*r room*r furnished:*r there*r make*r ready.*r
And*p they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.
And*p when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.
And*p he said unto them, With*r desire*r I*r have*r desired*r to*r eat*r this*r passover*r with*r you*r before*r I*r suffer:*r
For*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r I*r will*r not*r any*r more*r eat*r thereof,*r until*r it*r be*r fulfilled*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
And*p he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, Take*r this,*r and*r divide*r it*r among*r yourselves:*r
For*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r I*r will*r not*r drink*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine,*r until*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r shall*r come.*r
And*p he took bread, and gave thanks, and brake it, and gave unto them, saying, This*r is*r my*r body*r which*r is*r given*r for*r you:*r this*r do*r in*r remembrance*r of*r me.*r
Likewise*p also the cup after supper, saying, This*r cup*r is*r the*r new*r testament*r in*r my*r blood,*r which*r is*r shed*r for*r you.*r
But,*rp behold,*r the*r hand*r of*r him*r that*r betrayeth*r me*r is*r with*r me*r on*r the*r table.*r
And*rp truly*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r goeth,*r as*r it*r was*r determined:*r but*r woe*r unto*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r he*r is*r betrayed!*r
And*p they began to enquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.
And*p there was also a strife among them, which of them should be accounted the greatest.
And*p he said unto them, The*r kings*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r exercise*r lordship*r over*r them;*r and*r they*r that*r exercise*r authority*r upon*r them*r are*r called*r benefactors.*r
But*rp ye*r shall*r not*r be*r so:*r but*r he*r that*r is*r greatest*r among*r you,*r let*r him*r be*r as*r the*r younger;*r and*r he*r that*r is*r chief,*r as*r he*r that*r doth*r serve.*r
For*rp whether*r is*r greater,*r he*r that*r sitteth*r at*r meat,*r or*r he*r that*r serveth?*r is*r not*r he*r that*r sitteth*r at*r meat?*r but*r I*r am*r among*r you*r as*r he*r that*r serveth.*r
Ye*rp are*r they*r which*r have*r continued*r with*r me*r in*r my*r temptations.*r
And*rp I*r appoint*r unto*r you*r a*r kingdom,*r as*r my*r Father*r hath*r appointed*r unto*r me;*r
That*rp ye*r may*r eat*r and*r drink*r at*r my*r table*r in*r my*r kingdom,*r and*r sit*r on*r thrones*r judging*r the*r twelve*r tribes*r of*r Israel.*r
And*p the Lord said, Simon,*r Simon,*r behold,*r Satan*r hath*r desired*r to*r have*r you,*r that*r he*r may*r sift*r you*r as*r wheat:*r
But*rp I*r have*r prayed*r for*r thee,*r that*r thy*r faith*r fail*r not:*r and*r when*r thou*r art*r converted,*r strengthen*r thy*r brethren.*r
And*p he said unto him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison, and to death.
And*p he said, I*r tell*r thee,*r Peter,*r the*r cock*r shall*r not*r crow*r this*r day,*r before*r that*r thou*r shalt*r thrice*r deny*r that*r thou*r knowest*r me.*r
And*p he said unto them, When*r I*r sent*r you*r without*r purse,*r and*r scrip,*r and*r shoes,*r lacked*r ye*r any*r thing?*r And they said, Nothing.

Then*p said he unto them, But*r now,*r he*r that*r hath*r a*r purse,*r let*r him*r take*r it,*r and*r likewise*r his*r scrip:*r and*r he*r that*r hath*r no*r sword,*r let*r him*r sell*r his*r garment,*r and*r buy*r one.*r

For*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r that*r this*r that*r is*r written*r must*r yet*r be*r accomplished*r in*r me,*r And*r he*r was*r reckoned*r among*r the*r transgressors:*r for*r the*r things*r concerning*r me*r have*r an*r end.*r
And*p they said, Lord, behold, here are two swords. And he said unto them, It*r is*r enough.*r
And*p he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.
And*p when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray*r that*r ye*r enter*r not*r into*r temptation.*r
And*p he was withdrawn from them about a stone's cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,
Saying,*p Father,*r if*r thou*r be*r willing,*r remove*r this*r cup*r from*r me:*r nevertheless*r not*r my*r will,*r but*r thine,*r be*r done.*r
And*p there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.
And*p being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
And*p when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,
And*p said unto them, Why*r sleep*r ye?*r rise*r and*r pray,*r lest*r ye*r enter*r into*r temptation.*r
And*p while he yet spake, behold a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them, and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.
But*p Jesus said unto him, Judas,*r betrayest*r thou*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r with*r a*r kiss?*r
When*p they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?
And*p one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.
And*p Jesus answered and said, Suffer*r ye*r thus*r far.*r And he touched his ear, and healed him.
Then*p Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and the elders, which were come to him, Be*r ye*r come*r out,*r as*r against*r a*r thief,*r with*r swords*r and*r staves?*r
When*rp I*r was*r daily*r with*r you*r in*r the*r temple,*r ye*r stretched*r forth*r no*r hands*r against*r me:*r but*r this*r is*r your*r hour,*r and*r the*r power*r of*r darkness.*r
Then*p took they him, and led him, and brought him into the high priest's house. And Peter followed afar off.
And*p when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.
But*p a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and earnestly looked upon him, and said, This man was also with him.
And*p he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.
And*p after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou art also of them. And Peter said, Man, I am not.
And*p about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this fellow also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.
And*p Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.
And*p the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before*r the*r cock*r crow,*r thou*r shalt*r deny*r me*r thrice.*r
And*p Peter went out, and wept bitterly.
And*p the men that held Jesus mocked him, and smote him.
And*p when they had blindfolded him, they struck him on the face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy, who is it that smote thee?
And*p many other things blasphemously spake they against him.
And*p as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together, and led him into their council, saying,
Art*p thou the Christ? tell us. And he said unto them, If*r I*r tell*r you,*r ye*r will*r not*r believe:*r
And*rp if*r I*r also*r ask*r you,*r ye*r will*r not*r answer*r me,*r nor*r let*r me*r go.*r
Hereafter*rp shall*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r sit*r on*r the*r right*r hand*r of*r the*r power*r of*r God.*r
Then*p said they all, Art thou then the Son of God? And he said unto them, Ye*r say*r that*r I*r am.*r
And*p they said, What need we any further witness? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth.
